column4: sounds like something got typoed. can you !paste the terminal session
apt-file can help here
~:>  apt-file search toc2cue cdrdao: /usr/bin/toc2cue
thanks
I did" sudo apt-get install apt-file     and it replied missing destination file after apt-file. Do I just need to put in an absolute path and use any folder?
apt-get not apt=get
I ran the command and got a box that said, "apt-file update needed" when I ran that action, it gave me another box that said, "There was an error in creating the child process for this Terminal."
again a weird error so I'd like to see the terminal session
can I put screen shots in paste bin, because there is basically no terminal text
here is a paste of the apt-file result. Do I just need to unzip the file, or do I need to run something to
you didn't give a link
http://paste.ubuntu.com/691078/
sorry "apt-file search toc2cue" is what you type cdrdao is the answer
sorry I'm just not familiar with this is cdrdao a repository where I can get toc2cue?
no its the program you install. apt-file search fileneeded; suggests that package /path/to/fileneeded; so sudo apt-get install package
thanks
did you not install cdrdao
apt-get couldn't find it. I think it's because I don't have the repository that I need
man you must have a lot of spare time to sit here and help people all day!
im avoiding work
well I hope that works out for you! LOL
I can't believe it. It was in synaptic all the time. I ran apt-get install cdrdao but it didn't work. I didn't know that if it didn't work in apt-get that it could still be in synaptic.
thanks for your help. now maybe I can put my iso on my hard drive.
very odd
